Operation 'createCustomerServiceMetricTask' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects, poor_ai_interpretability. Missing summary entirely. Description is verbose and contains procedural guidance mixed with technical details. Improved summary provides clear action. Improved description: (1) clarifies the operation creates a task for report generation, (2) specifies required inputs and their purpose, (3) explains the output (location header with task URI), (4) documents the side effect (task creation for asynchronous processing), (5) clarifies CURRENT vs PROJECTED limitation, (6) consolidates the prerequisite guidance into actionable context. This helps AI agents understand when to use this operation and what to expect.

data.current_description:
Use this method to create a customer service metrics download task with filter criteria for the customer service metrics report. When using this method, specify the feedType and filterCriteria including both evaluationMarketplaceId and customerServiceMetricType for the report. The method returns the location response header containing the call URI to use with getCustomerServiceMetricTask to retrieve status and details on the task.

Only CURRENT Customer Service Metrics reports can be generated with the Sell Feed API. PROJECTED reports are not supported at this time. See the getCustomerServiceMetric method document in the Analytics API for more information about these two types of reports.

Note: Before calling this API, retrieve the summary of the seller's performance and rating for the customer service metric by calling getCustomerServiceMetric (part of the Analytics API). You can then populate the create task request fields with the values from the response. This technique eliminates failed tasks that request a report for a customerServiceMetricType and evaluationMarketplaceId that are without evaluation.
data.summary_suggestion: Create customer service metrics download task
data.description_suggestion: Creates a customer service metrics download task to generate a CURRENT Customer Service Metrics report. Required inputs: feedType and filterCriteria (including evaluationMarketplaceId and customerServiceMetricType). Returns a location response header with the task URI for polling status via getCustomerServiceMetricTask. Note: PROJECTED reports are not supported. Recommendation: Call getCustomerServiceMetric (Analytics API) first to validate the evaluationMarketplaceId and customerServiceMetricType combination exists before creating the task to avoid failures.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description is verbose and contains procedural guidance mixed with technical details. Improved summary provides clear action. Improved description: (1) clarifies the operation creates a task for report generation, (2) specifies required inputs and their purpose, (3) explains the output (location header with task URI), (4) documents the side effect (task creation for asynchronous processing), (5) clarifies CURRENT vs PROJECTED limitation, (6) consolidates the prerequisite guidance into actionable context. This helps AI agents understand when to use this operation and what to expect.

message: Operation 'getCustomerServiceMetricTask' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Missing summary entirely. Description is minimal and lacks clarity about what information is returned and the typical usage pattern. Improved summary provides clear action. Improved description: (1) explains the purpose (retrieve task status and details), (2) clarifies the input parameter and its origin, (3) specifies the response type (ServiceMetricsTask), (4) explains typical usage pattern (polling for completion), (5) indicates how to obtain download URI. This helps AI agents understand this is a polling operation and when to call it in the workflow.

data.current_description: Use this method to retrieve customer service metric task details for the specified task. The input is task_id.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve customer service metrics task details
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the status and details of a customer service metrics download task. Input: task_id (the task identifier returned from createCustomerServiceMetricTask). Returns a ServiceMetricsTask object containing task status, execution details, and report metadata. Use this method to poll task completion and retrieve the download URI once the task succeeds.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description is minimal and lacks clarity about what information is returned and the typical usage pattern. Improved summary provides clear action. Improved description: (1) explains the purpose (retrieve task status and details), (2) clarifies the input parameter and its origin, (3) specifies the response type (ServiceMetricsTask), (4) explains typical usage pattern (polling for completion), (5) indicates how to obtain download URI. This helps AI agents understand this is a polling operation and when to call it in the workflow.

message: Operation 'getOrderTasks' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context, poor_ai_interpretability. Missing summary entirely. Description is verbose and contains implementation details that confuse AI agents. Clarified the mutually exclusive parameter requirement, simplified the explanation, and added context about use cases and return type for better AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description:
This method returns the details and status for an array of order tasks based on a specified feed_type or schedule_id. Specifying both feed_type and schedule_id results in an error. Since schedules are based on feed types, you can specify a schedule (schedule_id) that returns the needed feed_type.

If specifying the feed_type, limit which order tasks are returned by specifying filters such as the creation date range or period of time using look_back_days.

If specifying a schedule_id, the schedule template (that the schedule_id is based on) determines which order tasks are returned (see schedule_id for additional information). Each schedule_id applies to one feed_type.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve order task details and status
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves details and status for multiple order tasks filtered by feed_type or schedule_id. Specify either feed_type (with optional date range or look_back_days filters) or schedule_id, but not both. Returns a paginated collection of OrderTask objects. Use this to monitor the progress of order download tasks or retrieve results from scheduled order reports.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description is verbose and contains implementation details that confuse AI agents. Clarified the mutually exclusive parameter requirement, simplified the explanation, and added context about use cases and return type for better AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description:
This method creates an order download task with filter criteria for the order report. When using this method, specify the feedType, schemaVersion, and filterCriteria for the report. The method returns the location response header containing the getOrderTask call URI to retrieve the order task you just created. The URL includes the eBay-assigned task ID, which you can use to reference the order task.

To retrieve the status of the task, use the getOrderTask method to retrieve a single task ID or the getOrderTasks method to retrieve multiple order task IDs.

Note: The scope depends on the feed type. An error message results when an unsupported scope or feed type is specified.

The following list contains this method's authorization scope and its corresponding feed type:

  • https://api.ebay.com/oauth/api_scope/sell.fulfillment: LMS_ORDER_REPORT

For details about how this method is used, see General feed types in the Selling Integration Guide.

Note: At this time, the createOrderTask method only supports order creation date filters and not modified order date filters. Do not include the modifiedDateRange filter in your request payload.
data.summary_suggestion: Create an order download task
data.description_suggestion: Creates an order download task with specified feed type, schema version, and optional filter criteria. Returns a location header containing the task URI with the eBay-assigned task ID for tracking. The task executes asynchronously; use getOrderTask or getOrderTasks to monitor status and retrieve results. Requires sell.fulfillment scope for LMS_ORDER_REPORT feed type. Note: Only supports order creation date filters; do not include modifiedDateRange in requests.

data.current_description:
This method creates an inventory-related download task for a specified feed type with optional filter criteria. When using this method, specify the feedType.

This method returns the location response header containing the getInventoryTask call URI to retrieve the inventory task you just created. The URL includes the eBay-assigned task ID, which you can use to reference the inventory task.

To retrieve the status of the task, use the getInventoryTask method to retrieve a single task ID or the getInventoryTasks method to retrieve multiple task IDs.

Note: The scope depends on the feed type. An error message results when an unsupported scope or feed type is specified.

Presently, this method supports Active Inventory Report. The ActiveInventoryReport returns a report that contains price and quantity information for all of the active listings for a specific seller. A seller can use this information to maintain their inventory on eBay.
data.summary_suggestion: Create an inventory download task

Currently supports ActiveInventoryReport, which returns price and quantity information for all active seller listings. Returns a location header containing the task URI with the eBay-assigned task ID for tracking. The task executes asynchronously; use getInventoryTask or getInventoryTasks to monitor status and retrieve results. Requires appropriate scope for the specified feed type.

message: Operation 'createSchedule' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Original summary is missing entirely. Description is verbose and difficult for AI agents to parse due to excessive HTML formatting and nested notes. Improved summary provides clear action-oriented statement. Improved description consolidates key information: purpose, required inputs (template fields), optional parameters, response format (HTTP 201 with Location header), constraints (schedule limits), and timing behavior. Removed HTML tags and reorganized for clarity.

data.current_description:
This method creates a schedule, which is a subscription to the specified schedule template. A schedule periodically generates a report for the feedType specified by the template. Specify the same feedType as the feedType of the associated schedule template. When creating the schedule, if available from the template, you can specify a preferred trigger hour, day of the week, or day of the month. These and other fields are conditionally available as specified by the template.

Note: Make sure to include all fields required by the schedule template (scheduleTemplateId). Call the getScheduleTemplate method (or the getScheduleTemplates method), to find out which fields are required or optional. If a field is optional and a default value is provided by the template, the default value will be used if omitted from the payload.

A successful call returns the location response header containing the getSchedule call URI to retrieve the schedule you just created. The URL includes the eBay-assigned schedule ID, which you can use to reference the schedule task.

To retrieve the details of the create schedule task, use the getSchedule method for a single schedule ID or the getSchedules method to retrieve all schedule details for the specified feed_type. The number of schedules for each feedType is limited. Error code 160031 is returned when you have reached this maximum.

Note: Except for schedules with a HALF-HOUR frequency, all schedules will ideally run at the start of each hour ('00' minutes). Actual start time may vary time may vary due to load and other factors.
data.summary_suggestion: Create a periodic report generation schedule
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new schedule that subscribes to a schedule template and periodically generates reports for the specified feed type. The schedule template determines which fields are required or optional; call getScheduleTemplate to identify required fields. Supports optional scheduling preferences (trigger hour, day of week, day of month) if available from the template. Returns HTTP 201 with a Location header containing the schedule ID for retrieving the created schedule. Maximum schedules per feed type is limited; error 160031 indicates the limit has been reached. Schedules run at the start of each hour (except HALF-HOUR frequency schedules) with actual timing subject to system load.
data.reasoning: Original summary is missing entirely. Description is verbose and difficult for AI agents to parse due to excessive HTML formatting and nested notes. Removed HTML tags and reorganized for clarity.

data.current_description:
This method returns the details and status for an array of tasks based on a specified feed_type or schedule_id. Specifying both feed_type and schedule_id results in an error. Since schedules are based on feed types, you can specify a schedule (schedule_id) that returns the needed feed_type.

If specifying the feed_type, limit which tasks are returned by specifying filters, such as the creation date range or period of time using look_back_days. Also, by specifying the feed_type, both on-demand and scheduled reports are returned.

If specifying a schedule_id, the schedule template (that the schedule ID is based on) determines which tasks are returned (see schedule_id for additional information). Each scheduledId applies to one feed_type.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve task details and status by feed type or schedule
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves an array of task details and processing status filtered by feed_type or schedule_id. Specify either feed_type (with optional date range or look_back_days filters) or schedule_id, but not both. When feed_type is specified, both on-demand and scheduled tasks are returned. Returns a paginated collection of Task objects with their current status (QUEUED, IN_PROCESS, COMPLETED, or COMPLETED_WITH_ERROR).

data.current_description:
This method creates an upload task or a download task without filter criteria. When using this method, specify the feedType and the feed file schemaVersion. The feed type specified sets the task as a download or an upload task.

For details about the upload and download flows, see Working with Order Feeds in the Selling Integration Guide.

Note: The scope depends on the feed type. An error message results when an unsupported scope or feed type is specified.

The following list contains this method's authorization scopes and their corresponding feed types:

  • https://api.ebay.com/oauth/api_scope/sell.inventory: See LMS FeedTypes
  • https://api.ebay.com/oauth/api_scope/sell.fulfillment: LMS_ORDER_ACK (specify for upload tasks). Also see LMS FeedTypes
  • https://api.ebay.com/oauth/api_scope/sell.marketing: None*
  • https://api.ebay.com/oauth/api_scope/commerce.catalog.readonly: None*

* Reserved for future release
data.summary_suggestion: Create an upload or download feed task
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new upload or download task for processing feed data. Requires feedType and schemaVersion parameters; the feedType determines whether the task is for uploading or downloading. Returns a Task object with a task_id that can be used to upload files (uploadFile) or monitor task status (getTask). Authorization scope required depends on feed type (sell.inventory, sell.fulfillment, sell.marketing, or commerce.catalog.readonly).

message: Operation 'uploadFile' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context. Missing summary. Description is verbose with excessive implementation details (form-data examples, header requirements). AI agents need to understand the asynchronous nature, status progression, and next steps. Reorganized to emphasize the workflow and key constraints.

data.current_description:
This method associates the specified file with the specified task ID and uploads the input file. After the file has been uploaded, the processing of the file begins.

Reports often take time to generate and it's common for this method to return an HTTP status of 202, which indicates the report is being generated. Use the getTask with the task ID or getTasks to determine the status of a report.

The status flow is QUEUED > IN_PROCESS > COMPLETED or COMPLETED_WITH_ERROR. When the status is COMPLETED or COMPLETED_WITH_ERROR, this indicates the file has been processed and the order report can be downloaded. If there are errors, they will be indicated in the report file.

For details of how this method is used in the upload flow, see Working with Order Feeds in the Selling Integration Guide.

This call does not have a JSON Request payload but uploads the file as form-data. For example:
 fileName: "AddFixedPriceItem_Macbook.xml" 
 name: "file" 
 type: "form-data" 
 file: @"/C:/Users/.../AddFixedPriceItem_Macbook.7z"
See Samples for information.

Note: This method applies to all Seller Hub feed types, and to all LMS feed types except LMS_ORDER_REPORT and LMS_ACTIVE_INVENTORY_REPORT.

Note: You must use a Content-Type header with its value set to "multipart/form-data". See Samples for information.

Note: For LMS feed types, upload a regular XML file or an XML file in zipped format (both formats are allowed).
data.summary_suggestion: Upload input file and initiate feed processing
data.description_suggestion: Uploads the input file for the specified task_id and initiates asynchronous processing. Accepts file as multipart/form-data (XML, zipped XML, or other supported formats). Returns HTTP 202 (Accepted) indicating processing has begun. Monitor task status using getTask or getTasks; status progresses through QUEUED > IN_PROCESS > COMPLETED or COMPLETED_WITH_ERROR. Once COMPLETED or COMPLETED_WITH_ERROR, download results via getResultFile. Applies to all Seller Hub and LMS feed types except LMS_ORDER_REPORT and LMS_ACTIVE_INVENTORY_REPORT.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description is verbose with excessive implementation details (form-data examples, header requirements). AI agents need to understand the asynchronous nature, status progression, and next steps. Reorganized to emphasize the workflow and key constraints.
